business.headline: Old vs new tax regime: Which one should you opt for in 2025-26?While the old tax regime promotes savings through tax benefits, the new one is simpler, involves less paperwork and reduces the chances of tax fraud.

Old vs new income tax regime: What to choose if you earn Rs 50 lakh per yearTaxpayers should consider a few key factors before making a choice. The old regime allows deductions, whereas the new regime offers lower tax rates but no major deductions.
Sensex closes over 500 points, Nifty above 23,300; NTPC gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 557.45 points to end at 76,905.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 159.75 points to close at 23,350.40.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Can AI pick winning stocks on Dalal Street? Check out these toolsOne of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

entertainment.headline: Ranveer Singh brings Rocky Randhawa's energy to wedding bash. WatchRanveer Singh's dance videos from a wedding went viral as he grooved to his hit songs. He was seen in his rugged Dhurandhar look as he enjoyed the celebrations.

Adolescence ending explained: Truth of Katie's death, and that devastating finaleAdolescence ends right where it starts - inside Jamie Miller's room. The Netflix series gives you a heart-breaking finale, where no one, neither you nor Jamie's parents, have anything to say but feel. Don't read ahead if you haven't watched the show already!

Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's Jolly LLB 3 gets release dateAkshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's Jolly LLB 3 will release in September 2025. Directed by Subhash Kapoor, the film also stars Saurabh Shukla and Huma Qureshi.

'Kitne aadmi the?' Not enough to remember today's films byBollywood's golden era gave us iconic dialogues, music, and moments. Today, films have become forgettable and do not have a lasting impact. Experts blame weak writing, fleeting music, and OTT overload for cinema's declining recall value.

Abhishek Bachchan says Aishwarya Rai's 'I want to talk' calls make him nervousAbhishek Bachchan joked about "I want to talk" calls from Aishwarya Rai stressing him out. The couple has been married for 17 years now.

Aamir calls Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar shoot 'torturous', admits getting actors firedAamir Khan reflects on the challenging making of Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar, revealing it was filmed twice. He also added that he got four rude actors fired.

Jack Harlow's long-awaited collaboration with Doja Cat, 'Just Us': Stream it nowJack Harlow and Doja Cat join forces for "Just Us," a long-awaited collaboration. The track follows Harlow's successful Jackman album and recent singles, fueling excitement for his upcoming projects.

Blake Lively seeks dismissal of Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuitBlake Lively seeks dismissal of Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit, calling it "vengeful". Baldoni countersued Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and The New York Times. A March 2026 trial is scheduled.

Netflix's 'Adolescence' soars to 24.3 million views in just four daysNetflix's crime drama Adolescence became a breakout hit with 24.3 million views, exploring a teen accused of murder. Its slow-burning tension, emotional depth, and realistic storytelling make it a must-watch.

Disney's Snow White: Controversies, delays & box office uncertaintyDisney's live-action Snow White faced delays, controversies, and budget woes. Casting backlash, political disputes, and a $270 million cost led to low confidence and uncertain box office projections.

Shah Rukh Khan arrives in Kolkata in style ahead of KKR vs RCB match. WatchSuperstar Shah Rukh Khan has arrived in the City of Joy. The actor landed in Kolkata in style as he was seen waving to fans before getting inside his car.

'Severance' Season 2 finale: Dichen Lachman shares behind-the-scenes detailsDichen Lachman shares behind-the-scenes information regarding Severance's Season 2 finale, including Gemma's tearful reunion with Mark, dramatic moments on set, and doubts regarding the future of the show.

Pete Davidson spotted with Elsie Hewitt: New romance rumours sparkPete Davidson was spotted with Elsie Hewitt, sparking dating rumours. The comedian has a history of high-profile relationships and recently made headlines for removing his tattoos, calling the process painful and lengthy.
Apple TV's Severance renewed for Season 3The critically acclaimed Apple TV show Severance has been renewed for a third season, Apple CEO Tim Cook shared. The show has been created by Ben Stiller.

Salaar re-releases in theatres: Fans cheer, dance, and celebrate Prabhas' filmPrabhas and Prithviraj Sukumaran's Salaar re-released in theatres on March 21. Several videos of fans celebrating the movie have surfaced online.

Taylor Swift named 21st century's most influential female artiste by BillboardBillboard has named Taylor Swift as the most influential female artist of the 21st century. Her chart-topping success and industry impact earn her the top spot on the list.

Prithviraj Sukumaran opens up about casting Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat in EmpuraanSouth star Prithviraj Sukumaran recently opened up about casting Aamir Khan's sister Nikhat Hegde in L2: Empuraan. Empuraan releases on March 27 in cinemas.

Disney confirms Coco sequel for 2029 with original director returningDisney has officially announced a sequel to its acclaimed animated film Coco. The film, set for release in 2029, is currently in early development stages.
Ektaa Kapoor shares a cryptic post after Anurag Kashyap praises AdolescenceEktaa Kapoor shared a cryptic message on social media following Anurag Kashyap's praise for the show, Adolescence.

general news.headline: Meerut woman partied in Kasol, Manali with lover days after husband's murderAfter murdering her 29-year-old husband, Saurabh Rajput, Muskan Rastogi and her boyfriend, Sahil Shukla, both 27, checked into Hotel Purnima in Kasol on March 10. They were in Manali before arriving in Kasol in a taxi.

Never accepted illegal occupation: Centre on China's 'new counties' in LadakhIn a written response to a query in Lok Sabha, Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh said that India never accepted the "illegal Chinese occupation of the Indian Territory".

New season, new fortunes? Revamped RCB face ageless spin-threat from KKRIPL 2025, Kolkata Knight Riders vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Match Preview: The two teams, under the leadership of new captains, meet in the first match of the IPL. As rain threatens the opener at Eden, will either style be able to impress the fans on Saturday?

Mapping India's GDB: Survey reveals how states fare in social behaviourIndia might be the fastest-growing economy, but how does it fare on social indicators like civic behaviour, safety, gender attitudes and diversity? A first-of-its-kind survey by India Today across 21 states sheds light on the social progress of the country.

IPL turns 18: Vintage vibe, new tribe, same hypeThe IPL turns 18, blending nostalgia with fresh energy. While a new generation steps up, OGs like MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma still dominate the headlines. The excitement remains unchanged, but with new captains and evolving narratives, the league continues to reinvent itself.

Delhi judge embroiled in cash row was named in CBI case in 2018The alleged cash recovery from Justice Yashwant Varma's residence has revived scrutiny over his past financial dealings, particularly his ties to the 2018 Simbhaoli Sugar Mill fraud case.

Madhya Pradesh woman returns alive 18 months after 4 jailed for her 'murder'According to Lalita's father, the family had identified a mutilated body based on physical markings, including a tattoo on the hand and a black thread tied around the leg. Convinced that it was Lalita, the family performed the last rites.

Trump orders firings at watchdog tasked with immigration policy checks: ReportThe Trump administration has placed the entire civil rights division of the Department of Homeland Security on two months' leave and told them to find a job within this period or be fired in May.

'Kitne aadmi the?' Not enough to remember today's films byBollywood's golden era gave us iconic dialogues, music, and moments. Today, films have become forgettable and do not have a lasting impact. Experts blame weak writing, fleeting music, and OTT overload for cinema's declining recall value.

Is travelling ticketless, paying bribe okay? GDB survey will shock youIndia is doing well economically and that is visible through its GDP numbers. But how do its citizens fare when it comes to social responsibilities and civic sense? The India Today Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey for the first time reveals what Indians think about tampering with electric meters or travelling without tickets.

Indian students in US must follow local laws, says government amid deportationsExternal Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said decisions on visa and immigration policy are the sole prerogative of respective countries and the respective laws must be complied with.

Airline refuses to let US woman fly with dog, she drowns it in airport toiletA Louisiana woman was arrested after allegedly drowning her dog in a bathroom at Orlando airport after she was denied boarding due to improper paperwork, sparking outrage amongst animal advocates.

Woman doctor, 25, found dead at Bhopal home with needle marks on her armWhen Dr Richa did not respond on Friday morning, her husband sought help from the neighbours, and when their efforts failed, a labourer was called to break open the door, where she was found unconscious on the bed. She was later declared dead.

London's Heathrow resumes flights after fire led to shutdown, stranded thousandsA fire knocked out the power supply of Europe's busiest airport for the day, stranding tens of thousands of passengers and causing travel turmoil worldwide.

Why Indians pay a high price for dental treatmentsA recent survey highlights the unpredictable nature of dental treatment costs in India. The lack of standard pricing means patients often have no clarity on what constitutes a fair charge.

Adolescence: Teens and mind-boggling coded world of kidney beans, purple hearts'Adolescence' opens the door to a whole new world for parents and guardians, where teenagers are creating their own language, encrypted with codes and symbols. How scary is that!

Trump strips legal status of 530,000 migrants, paving way for mass deportationsThe Trump administration will revoke the temporary legal status of 530,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans, and Venezuelans, effective April 24, reversing the parole program introduced by Joe Biden, potentially making many vulnerable to deportation.

Why Shivaji's grandson went on pilgrimage to Aurangzeb's tombShahu I, the grandson of Shivaji and son of Shambhaji who was executed by the Mughals, visited Aurangzeb's grave. The visit by Shahuji, who was kept captive for 18 years in a Mughal camp, has to be seen in the correct historical and political context, and his battle with Maratha queen Tarabai Bhosle.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
